__e: You go with Debra and the kids in our car and this way there doesn't need to be any talking.
I told you the stairs were bad so you wouldn't know what Debra and I were doing, and you wouldn't have broken your rib if it wasn't for me, and I'm buying you a satellite dish, all right?
Part of me always thinks, "Why can't Mom and Dad get along with Debra and me... and Robert... and Amy?"
I can't have Debra think... I didn't care enough about her to go to a real jeweler.
It was her head that ends up on Debra's body, we can't allow it to happen.
